Introducing Accessibility

Contents | Index

Oracle's Siebel Business Applications are designed to meet the needs of users with disabilities, and conform to many of the guidelines specified by the following:

  • World Wide Web Consortium Accessibility Initiative (W3C WAI) 1.0
  • U.S. Government Rehabilitation Act 1998 Section 508 (29 U.S.C. ï¿½ 794 (d))

Oracle is committed to improving support for accessibility features and uses popular assistive technologies, such as screen readers, speech synthesizers, and alternative keyboards to test applications.

Oracle provides a large number of keyboard shortcuts (also known as access keys or hot keys) to enable all users to navigate Siebel CRM elements, such as applets and records, without using a mouse.

Note: Your Siebel administrator must configure the Siebel application to ensure that the accessibility features are available to you.

Developers and integrators must also follow accessibility standards to preserve the accessibility features when customizing Siebel Business Applications.

For more information about how to develop, configure, and use the accessibility features for Siebel CRM, see Accessibility Guide for Siebel Business Applications on Oracle Technology Network (OTN).

For more information about Oracle's Accessibility Program, visit the Web site at:

http://www.oracle.com/accessibility/
